birth certificate.description: A Birth Certificate is an official document that records the birth of a person.
birth certificate.how_to_apply: You can apply online via your municipal corporation's website or in person at the local registrar office.
birth certificate.documents_required: Proof of birth (hospital record), parents' ID proof, residence proof.

caste certificate.description: A Caste Certificate is used to prove a person’s caste, especially for reservation benefits.
caste certificate.how_to_apply: Apply through the state government portal or Tehsil office.
caste certificate.documents_required: ID proof, residence proof, caste verification affidavit.
caste certificate.fees: Usually free or a small fee.

marriage certificate.description: A Marriage Certificate is an official document that certifies the legal union of a couple.
marriage certificate.how_to_apply: Apply at the local municipal office or online via the state registration portal.
marriage certificate.documents_required: Marriage application form, age proof, residence proof, wedding photos, witnesses’ ID proofs.
marriage certificate.fees: Rs. 100 to Rs. 500 depending on the state.

death certificate.description: A Death Certificate officially records the death of an individual and is required for legal and administrative purposes.
death certificate.how_to_apply: Apply through the local municipal authority where the death occurred, either online or offline.
death certificate.documents_required: Proof of death (hospital report), ID of deceased, residence proof, application form.

pan card.description: A Permanent Account Number (PAN) card is a unique identifier issued by the Income Tax Department.
pan card.how_to_apply: Apply online through NSDL or UTIITSL portals or offline via authorized PAN centers.
pan card.documents_required: Proof of identity, proof of address, date of birth proof, photographs.

driving licence.description: A Driving Licence authorizes an individual to drive vehicles on public roads.
driving licence.how_to_apply: Apply online via the Parivahan portal or visit the local RTO office.
driving licence.documents_required: Learner's licence, age proof, address proof, passport-sized photos.
driving licence.fees: Rs. 200 to Rs. 500 depending on licence type.
driving licence.processing_time: Typically 15 to 30 days including driving test.

income certificate.description: An Income Certificate is a document that certifies an individual’s income from all sources.
income certificate.how_to_apply: Apply online through state government portals or at Tehsil offices.
income certificate.documents_required: Application form, salary slip or income proof, residence proof, ID proof.
income certificate.fees: Free or a nominal fee depending on state.
